intro: Cracca curtissii, commonly known as the Curtiss's cracca, is a rare flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and thrives in partial shade. Its flowers are yellow, with a distinctive central disc and surrounding ray florets. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a sensitive indicator species for ecosystem health.
